monogr.title: Keepe within compasse: or, the worthy legacy of a wise father to his beloued sonne : teaching him how to liue richly in this world and eternally happy in the world to come. Meete for all sorts of people whatsoeuer

lg.l: PEruse this Diall euery day,
Wherein no hower shall passe away,
But by it thou shalt learne to finde
Some Iewell to inrich thy minde.
Count one the first hower of thy breath.
And all the rest to lead to death.
Count twelue thy dolefull passing Bell,
And so my Dyall shall goe well.

lg.head: I
lg.l: ONe God, one Baptisme, and one Faith,
One Truth there is, the Scripture saith.

lg.head: II
lg.l: Two Testaments, the Olde and New,
Wee must acknowledge to be true.

lg.head: III
lg.l: Three Persons in the Trinitie
Doe make one God in Vnitie.

lg.head: IIII
lg.l: Foure holy Euangelists there are,
Which Christs birth, life & death declare.

lg.head: V
lg.l: Fiue wounds the Iewes our Sauiour gaue,
Whence flow'd the bloud that all men saue.

lg.head: VI
lg.l: Sixe dayes to labour is no wrong:
For God himselfe did worke so long.

lg.head: VII
lg.l: Seauen deadly Sinnes in man doe rest,
Which once expell'd, mans soule is blest.

lg.head: VIII
lg.l: Eight in Noahs Arke alone were found,
When in a word the world lay drown'd.

lg.head: IX
lg.l: Nine Hyrarchies of Angels rayse
Both day and night Iehouahs praise.

lg.head: X
lg.l: Tenne Statutes God to Moses gaue,
Which broke or kept, doe spill or saue.

lg.head: XI
lg.l: Eleauen aboue with God doe dwell,
The twelfth burnes in perpetuall hell.

lg.head: XII
lg.l: Twelue attended on Gods Sonne,
Twelue made the Creede: my Dyall's done.
